thread.title: Look: Mom sends student box of trash he failed to take out
thread.title_full: Look: Mom sends student box of trash he failed to take out - UPI.com

author: Ben Hooper
title: Look: Mom sends student box of trash he failed to take out
text:
Thought my mom was sending me a care package... but instead she sent me a box of trash i was supposed to take out. pic.twitter.com/UetdT5UoVP
â€” Connor Cox (@thedeal_5) January 30, 2017 Feb. 21 (UPI) -- A Pennsylvania college student said he opened up a care package from his mother and found something unexpected -- the trash he had forgotten to take out on Christmas break.
Connor Cox, a freshman at Westminster College in New Wilmington, posted a photo to Twitter showing the box full of trash his mother sent him at school.
"Thought my mom was sending me a care package... but instead she sent me a box of trash i was supposed to take out," Cox tweeted.
Cox said he had been expecting some of the comforts of home.
"It's like Christmas," told KDKA-TV of receiving a care package from his mother. "Six hours away, I can't really go home and go to the grocery store because I don't have a car up here, so it's a really good feeling."
"I received a box like this, and I was expecting a bunch of food, chips, stuff like that," he said. "And I opened it up, and saw a bunch of trash! I called my mom and we talked about it. Asked her if she sent me the wrong box, because that's how confused I was. But she said it was the right box, and I had to be held responsible for what I didn't do."
Cox said he was supposed to throw the trash away when he was home for winter break, but he neglected to finish the chore.
"I thought I could get away with it this one time," he said, "but, obviously, I didn't."
 Florida college student grades ex-girlfriend's apology letter, gives it a D- Speeder caught using mannequin to cheat carpool lane in Washington state Nashville singer poses for Valentine's photos with her true love -- pizza
